thread.title: Steve Doerschuk's NFL power rankings: Week 7
thread.title_full: Steve Doerschuk's NFL power rankings: Week 7

author: Steve Doerschuk
title: Steve Doerschuk's NFL power rankings: Week 7
text: • Steve Doerschuk's NFL power rankings: Week 4 • 1 (1) Packers (6-0, bye week, Nov. 1 at Denver) Cambridge, Ohio native Dom Capers, who was Larry Kehres roommate back in the day at Mount Union, has been part of Green Bay teams posting a 73-28-1 since he took over as defensive coordinator. Only three teams have allowed fewer points than Capers' Packers in 2015. • 2 (2), Patriots (5-0, 1 p.m. vs. Jets) Head coach Bill Belichick’s father, Steve, based his coaching principles on the man from Massillon, Paul Brown. Offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels played for McKinley in the unforgettable 100th McKinley-Massillon game in Paul Brown Tiger Stadium. McDaniels' unit ranks second in total offense in 2015. • 3 (3), Bengals (6-0, bye week, Nov. 1 at Pittsburgh) Mike Nugent, who kicked for Ohio State in the 2002 national championship game, is in his sixth year with Cincinnati. LB A.J. Hawk, in his first year with he Bengals, made it into the '02 title game as a Buckeye freshman. • 4 (7), Panthers (5-0, 8:30 p.m. vs. Eagles) It is going on nine years since Ted Ginn Jr. stunned Urban Meyer’s Florida Gators by returning the opening kickoff for a touchdown in a national championship game, only to get an ankle mangled when teammates flesh-piled him to celebrate. At 30, the former Cleveland Glenville star has started all five games at wideout and is among the NFL's punt return leaders. • 5 (4), Broncos (6-0, bye week, Nov. 1 vs. Packers) CB Bradley Roby came away from Sunday's game at Cleveland saying, "Some people recognized me. I heard "O-H" a few times. He was a first-round draft pick out of Ohio State in 2014. • 6 (8), Jets (4-1, 1 p.m. at New England) Rookie Round 2 pick Devin Smith (Massillon/Ohio State) has caught five passes since returning from a rib injury amid concerns Ryan Fitzpatrick lacks the arm strength to get him the deep ball. Centerville native Nick Mangold has been a top center since arriving from Ohio State in 2006. • 7 (6), Falcons (5-1, 1 p.m. at Tennessee) If Mike Pettine hadn't landed the Browns head coaching job in 2014, Dan Quinn (hired by Atlanta in '15) probably would have. Former Browns interim head coach Terry Robiskie is in his eighth year as a Falcons assistant. • 8 (5), Cardinals (4-2, Monday night vs. Ravens) Head coach Bruce Arians was offensive coordinator of the Browns in their only expansion-era playoff game. He practically begged to be hired as Cleveland's head coach in 2013. • 9 (13), Steelers (4-2, 1 p.m. at Kansas City) Pittsburgh has collected more Ohio players than the Browns for many years. Notable long-timer James Harrison (Coventry/Hoban/Kent State) has sacked Joe Flacco and Carson Palmer within the last three games. Page 2 of 4 - • 10 (10) Seahawks (3-4, won Thursday night at San Francisco) Youngstown native Sherman Smith, a quarterback on Miami (Ohio) teams that beat SEC opponents three straight years in bowl games, is Marshawn Lynch’s position coach. • 11 ( 22), Eagles (3-3, 8:30 p.m. at Carolina) Center Jason Kelce (Cleveland Heights/Cincinnati) worked his way from Round 6 pick in 2011 to Pro Bowl in 2014. Ex-Browns head coach Pat Shumur is offensive coordinator for tight end Brent Celek, a former Cincinnati LaSalle star who has 4,375 NFL receiving yards. • 12 (12), Colts (3-3, 1 p.m. vs. New Orleans) Toledo native Jack Mewhort (Toledo St. John's/Ohio State) and Sylvania native Hugh Thornton start on the offensive line. Toledo native Rob Chudzinski, the Browns' head coach in 2013, is associate head coach. • 13 (14), Vikings (3-2, 1 p.m. at Detroit) General manager Rick Spielman was a high school quarterback at Timken and Massillon on his way to a career as an NFL personnel man. He hired head coach Mike Zimmer away from the Bengals. • 14 (11), Bills (3-3, 9:30 vs. Jaguars in London) Center Eric Wood, who helped Cincinnati Elder win two Ohio high school championships, is Buffalo's Alex Mack — a 2009 Round 1 pick who has started from Day 1 of his rookie year. • 15 (9), Giants (3-3, 4:25 p.m. vs. Cowboys) DT Jonathan Hankins, a Round 2 pick out of Ohio State in 2013, had a breakout 2014 with seven sacks. He has started 22 straight games. • 16 (15), Saints (2-4), 1 p.m. at Indianapolis) Former McKinley speedster Joe Morgan, who averaged 37.9 yards on 10 catches for the 2012 Saints, was released this year but re-signed on Oct. 13. Milford native Zach Strief, 32, is a long-timer at right tackle. • 17 (17) Raiders (2-3, 4:05 p.m. at San Diego) Safety Charles Woodson, Ohio's 1994 Mr. Football out of Fremont Ross, added Peyton Manning to his pick list, twice, in his most recent game. He needs 34 interception return yards to reach 1,000 for his career. • 18 (16), Chargers (2-4, 4:05 p.m. vs. Raiders) TE Antonio Gates, a bruising Kent State basketball player, has 101 touchdown catches on his way, maybe, to Canton. • 19 (27), Dolphins (2-3, 1 p.m. vs. Texans) Linebackers coach Mark Duffner broke into the business as a Woody Hayes assistant at Ohio State in the 1970s. • 20 (21), Rams (2-3, 1 p.m. vs. Browns) LB James Laurinaitis won college football's Bronko Nagurski, Dick Butkus and Jack Lambert awards while at Ohio State. He has made 101 straight NFL starts. • 21 (20), Cowboys (2-3, 4:25 p.m. at New York Giants) Anthony Hitchens (Lorain Clearview) is in his second year as a starter. He was drafted last year in Round 4, a round later than the Browns took his former Iowa teammate Christian Kirksey. Page 3 of 4 - • 22 (18), Browns (2-4, 1 p.m. at St. Louis) Wideout Brian Hartline, who played in the Federal League (GlenOak), and guard John Greco, who played for former Federal League member Boardman, practice against safety Donte Whitner (Cleveland Glenville/Ohio State) and defensive lineman John Hughes (Gahanna Lincoln/Cincinnati). • 23 (19), Redskins (2-4, 1 p.m. vs. Buccaneers) Former Mount Union star Pierre Garcon is in his seventh year as an NFL starter, with 32 catches this year and 445 in his career. Center Kory Lichtensteiger (Convoy Crestview/Bowling Green) has made 72 NFL starts. • 24 (23), Ravens (1-4, Monday night at Arizona) FB Kyle Juszczyk (Cloverleaf) has two NFL touchdowns, both against the Browns. Head coach John Harbaugh’s parents were Ohioans and huge Browns fans. • 25 (30), Texans (2-4, 1 p.m. at Miami) Former St. Ignatius Wildcat/Cleveland Brown Brian Hoyer ranks seventh in the NFL with a 103.0 passer rating. He completed four passes to Cecil Shorts (Cleveland Collinwood/Mount Union) last Sunday. • 26 (24), Buccaneers (2-3, 1 p.m. at Washington) George Warhop was a Cleveland position coach longer than anyone else in the Browns' expansion era, an eternity of five years. He is Tampa Bay's offensive line coach now. • 27 (28), Chiefs (1-5, 1 p.m. vs. Steelers) Travis Kelce (29 catches, 416 yards) is in the mix with Gary Barnidge (27, 413) and Rob Gronkowski (23, 425) as this year's most productive tight ends. Kelce played high school ball for Cleveland Heights. • 28 (31), Lions (1-5, 1 p.m. vs. Vikings) Lance Moore (Westerville South/Toledo) delivered 106 yards last Sunday's against Chicago, at age 33. Head coach Jim Caldwell was mentored by the late Bob Commings, a member of the Stark County High School Football Hall of Fame. • 29 (25), Titans (1-4, 1 p.m. vs. Atlanta) Bishop Sankey (Wadsworth), the first running back drafted in 2014, has run for 728 yards in his first 21 games as a Titan. Dick LeBeau, who played for an Ohio State national championship team and was drafted by the Browns, is the Titans' 78-year-old assistant head coach. • 30 (26), Bears (2-4, bye week, Nov. 1 vs. Vikings) The coaching staff includes Stan Drayton (Cleveland native), Ed Donatell (Akron native), Dowell Loggains ("wreck this league" text recipient while Cleveland QBs coach in 2014) and Frank Smith (blocked for Ben Roethlisberger at Miami). • 31 (32), 49ers (2-5, lost Thursday night to Seahawks) Former Browns public relations intern (and later head coach) Eric Mangini is defensive coordinator. Left guard Alex Boone (Lakewood St. Edward/Ohio State) has helped Carlos Hyde (Cincinnati Princeton/Ohio State) rush for 470 yards as a second-year pro. • 32 (29), Jaguars (1-5, 9:30 a.m. vs. Bills in London) Page 4 of 4 - Rookie Round 6 pick Michael Bennett (Centerville/Ohio State) has worked his way into all six games in Jacksonville's defensive line rotation. Reach Steve at 330-580-8347 or steve.doerschuk @cantonrep.com On Twitter: @sdoerschukREP
